snippet: President Obama wants to tweak the abusive surveillance programs, but they will still go on.
abstract: Editorial dismisses Pres Obama's proposed changes to government surveillance programs, saying they are superficial and will do little to restore privacy; argues if Obama is unwilling to effect true reform, then Congress will have to step in to stop indiscriminate collection of communications data.
lead_paragraph: President Obama wants to tweak the abusive surveillance programs, but they will still go on.

headline.main: A Weak Agenda on Spying Reform
headline.print_headline: A Weak Agenda on Spying Reform
